summary.en: “dep” is an informal abbreviation that most often means “department,” and sometimes “deputy” or (in texting) “depressed,” depending on context.
summary.zh: “dep”是非正式缩写，最常见表示“部门”，也可能表示“副职/代理（deputy）”或（聊天中）“情绪低落（depressed）”，需看语境。

definition.en: (informal) An abbreviation used in notes or messages meaning “department.”
definition.zh: （非正式）缩写，表示“部门”。

examples.en: Send your request to the IT dep.
examples.zh: 把你的申请发给 IT 部门。

examples.en: I’m meeting with the sales dep this afternoon.
examples.zh: 我今天下午要和销售部门开会。

definition.en: (informal) An abbreviation meaning “deputy” (a person who acts for someone else).
definition.zh: （非正式）缩写，表示“副手；代理人；副职（deputy）”。

examples.en: Please ask the dep manager to sign this form.
examples.zh: 请让副经理在这张表上签字。

examples.en: The dep will handle the case while the supervisor is away.
examples.zh: 主管不在时，副手会处理这个案件。

definition.en: (very informal, texting) Short for “depressed,” meaning feeling very sad or low.
definition.zh: （很口语/网络用语）depressed 的缩写，表示“情绪低落/抑郁”。

examples.en: I’ve been feeling kinda dep lately.
examples.zh: 我最近有点情绪低落。

examples.en: If you’re dep for days, talk to someone you trust.
examples.zh: 如果你连续几天都很低落，和你信任的人聊聊。

extraExplanation: “dep”不是一个非常标准的通用缩写，具体含义高度依赖语境（工作邮件里常见=department；职位/组织结构里可能=deputy；聊天里可能=depressed）。正式写作中建议直接写全称，避免误解。

summary.en: “DEPA” most commonly refers to the Digital Economy Partnership Agreement; “depa” can also be an informal short form for words like department or departure, depending on context.
summary.zh: “DEPA”最常见指《数字经济伙伴关系协定》；“depa”也可能是department或departure等词的非正式简写，具体看语境。

definition.en: DEPA: an abbreviation used for the Digital Economy Partnership Agreement, an international agreement about digital trade and cooperation.
definition.zh: DEPA：常见缩写，指《数字经济伙伴关系协定》，是一项关于数字贸易与数字合作的国际协定。

examples.en: Several countries joined DEPA to support smoother digital trade.
examples.zh: 一些国家加入DEPA，以促进更顺畅的数字贸易。

examples.en: The report discusses how DEPA could shape rules for cross-border data flows.
examples.zh: 这份报告讨论了DEPA可能如何影响跨境数据流动的规则。

definition.en: depa (informal): a shortened form people may type for “department,” “departure,” or “depart,” depending on context (not standard in formal writing).
definition.zh: depa（非正式）：有时被当作“department（部门）”“departure（出发/离开）”或“depart（离开）”的简写输入，但不属于正式标准写法。

examples.en: Send it to the depa email list. (informal, better: department)
examples.zh: 把它发到depa的邮件列表。（非正式，更好写法：department）

examples.en: Our depa time is 6 p.m. (informal, better: departure time)
examples.zh: 我们的depa时间是晚上6点。（非正式，更好写法：departure time）

extraExplanation: “depa”本身不是一个常见的英语单词，更常见的是作为缩写或聊天/笔记里的随手简写。正式写作中建议直接写全称（如 department / departure / depart）。
如果你告诉我你看到“depa”的句子或场景（例如商务、机场、游戏、聊天），我可以帮你确定最准确的意思。

summary.en: Depaganize means to remove pagan elements from something, or to convert people away from pagan religions (often in historical contexts).
summary.zh: depaganize 指“去除异教元素”，也可指使人从异教信仰改宗（多见于历史语境）。

definition.en: to remove pagan beliefs, practices, or symbols from something; to make something less pagan
definition.zh: 去除（某事物中的）异教/异教徒信仰、习俗或象征；使之不那么“异教化”

examples.en: Some festivals were depaganized over time by adding Christian meanings to older customs.
examples.zh: 一些节日随着时间推移被“去异教化”，通过给较古老的习俗加入基督教含义。

examples.en: The group tried to depaganize the ceremony by removing references to multiple gods.
examples.zh: 该团体试图通过去掉对多神的提及来“去异教化”这场仪式。

definition.en: to convert people from pagan religions to another religion (often Christianity)
definition.zh: 使（人群）从异教信仰改宗到另一种宗教（常指基督教）

examples.en: Historical records describe efforts to depaganize rural communities.
examples.zh: 历史记录描述了对乡村社区进行“去异教化/改宗”的努力。

extraExplanation: 词源上是 de-（去除、反向）+ pagan（异教的）+ -ize（使成为……）。它常出现在历史、宗教学语境中，讨论“基督教化/一神教化”过程中对传统习俗的改造（例如保留节日形式，但赋予新的宗教解释）。
语感提示：这个词比较少见，语气可能带有立场色彩。在中性写法里，有时会用更常见的表达，如 “remove pagan elements（去除异教元素）” 或 “Christianize（基督教化）”。

summary.en: “Depaint” is an uncommon verb meaning “to depict/portray,” and more rarely “to remove paint.”
summary.zh: “depaint”是不太常用的动词，主要可指“描绘/刻画”，更少见时也可指“去除油漆”。

definition.en: to describe or show something in words or images; to depict or portray
definition.zh: （用文字或图像）描绘；刻画；表现

examples.en: The novel depaints the city as noisy but full of hope.
examples.zh: 这部小说把这座城市描绘得喧闹却充满希望。

examples.en: The artist depainted everyday life with simple, warm colors.
examples.zh: 这位艺术家用朴素温暖的色彩描绘日常生活。

definition.en: to remove paint from a surface (rare; more commonly: “strip paint” or “remove paint”)
definition.zh: 去除表面的油漆（较少见；更常用：strip/remove paint）

examples.en: We depainted the old door before repainting it.
examples.zh: 我们先把旧门的漆去掉，再重新上漆。

extraExplanation: “depaint”在现代英语里不算常用词。表达“描绘”时，更常见、更自然的是“depict / portray”。在艺术评论、较正式或文学语境中偶尔能见到“depaint”。
如果你的意思是“去漆”，英语母语者通常说“strip the paint (off)”或“remove the paint”，而不是“depaint”。
前缀“de-”常有“去除/反向”的意思（如 devalue 贬值、deactivate 解除激活），这也解释了“depaint”会被理解为“去除油漆”。

summary.en: “Depainted” usually means “paint removed/stripped,” and it can also be the past form of the verb “depaint” (to remove paint).
summary.zh: “depainted”通常指“被去漆/被剥漆的”，也可作动词“depaint（去漆）”的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: having had paint removed; stripped of paint
definition.zh: （表面）被去漆的；被剥掉油漆的

examples.en: The old door was depainted before it was refinished.
examples.zh: 旧门在重新上漆前先被去漆处理。

examples.en: They found depainted layers that revealed the wood grain underneath.
examples.zh: 他们发现去漆后的层面，露出了下面的木纹。

definition.en: past form of “depaint”: to remove paint from something
definition.zh: “depaint”的过去式/过去分词：给……去漆；把……的油漆去掉

examples.en: The workers depainted the metal railings with a chemical stripper.
examples.zh: 工人们用化学脱漆剂给金属栏杆去漆。

examples.en: She depainted the frame carefully to avoid damaging the surface.
examples.zh: 她小心地给画框去漆，避免伤到表面。

extraExplanation: “depaint”这个词在日常英语中不算常见。更常见的说法是：strip the paint (off), remove the paint, paint-stripped, paint removed。
在文物修复、家具翻新等语境里，你更可能看到“stripped/paint-stripped/stripped of paint”。如果你是在文学或旧文献里遇到“depainted”，通常也是指“把漆去掉/去除涂层”。

summary.en: “Depainting” usually means AI-based image object/text removal with realistic filling (inpainting); less commonly, it means removing paint from a surface.
summary.zh: depainting 通常指用 AI 将图像中的物体/文字移除并自然补全（inpainting）；较少见时也可指除漆。

definition.en: (computing, especially AI) The process of removing unwanted parts of an image (such as objects, text, or damage) and filling in the missing area so the result looks natural; also called “inpainting.”
definition.zh: （计算机/AI）指把图片中不需要的部分（如物体、文字或破损）去除，并把空缺区域“补全”到看起来自然的过程；也常叫 inpainting（图像修补/补绘）。

examples.en: This app uses depainting to remove tourists from travel photos.
examples.zh: 这个应用用 depainting 把旅行照里的游客去掉。

examples.en: The model learned depainting from pairs of damaged and restored images.
examples.zh: 这个模型通过“受损图像—修复图像”的成对数据学习 depainting。

examples.en: De-painting tools can erase watermarks, but you should respect copyright and permissions.
examples.zh: 去除水印的 depainting 工具确实存在，但应尊重版权与授权。

definition.en: The act of removing paint from a surface (less common).
definition.zh: 去除表面涂料/油漆的行为（较少见）。

examples.en: Depainting is needed before repainting old metal railings.
examples.zh: 旧金属栏杆重新上漆前需要先做 depainting（除漆）。

examples.en: Wear gloves during depainting to protect your skin.
examples.zh: 除漆（depainting）时要戴手套保护皮肤。

extraExplanation: 在影像领域，depainting 常与 inpainting 近义：强调“去掉某物并补全背景”，常用于“去物体（object removal）”“修复老照片”“去文字/涂鸦”等任务。
实际写作中更常见的术语是 inpainting；depainting 有时出现在论文、开源项目或产品功能描述里，用来突出“先移除再补全”的步骤。

summary.en: “Depaints” means “portrays/depicts,” usually in a literary or somewhat old-fashioned style.
summary.zh: “depaints”意为“描绘/刻画（=depicts/portrays）”，多见于文学或偏旧的文体。

definition.en: (third-person singular of “depaint”) to portray or represent someone or something in words, art, or imagination; to depict.
definition.zh: （“depaint”的第三人称单数）用文字、艺术或想象来描绘/表现某人或某事；刻画。

examples.en: The novel depaints the city as both beautiful and cruel.
examples.zh: 这部小说把这座城市描绘得既美丽又残酷。

examples.en: In the poem, the author depaints winter as a quiet teacher.
examples.zh: 在这首诗里，作者把冬天刻画成一位安静的老师。

definition.en: (less common) to paint (a picture) or to paint so as to show particular features; to paint in a descriptive way.
definition.zh: （较少见）通过绘画来呈现（某物）的特征；描绘成某种样子。

examples.en: The artist depaints the shoreline with soft, pale colors.
examples.zh: 画家用柔和、浅淡的颜色描绘海岸线。

extraExplanation: “depaint”在现代英语中比较少见，更多时候人们用“depict”“portray”或“paint”。你看到“depaints”通常是在文学、旧文体或为了强调“描绘/刻画”的语气时。
与“describe”相比，“depaint/depict”更强调把形象“呈现出来”（让读者/观者仿佛看见）；与“paint”相比，它不一定真的用颜料，也可以用文字来“画面化”描写。

summary.en: “Depair” is usually a misspelling of “despair,” meaning a loss of hope (noun) or to lose hope (verb).
summary.zh: “depair”通常是“despair”的误拼，意思是“绝望/失去希望”（名词）或“感到绝望”（动词）。

definition.en: (Common spelling: despair) a strong feeling that you have no hope and that nothing will get better.
definition.zh: （常见拼写：despair）绝望；强烈的无望感，觉得事情不会变好。

examples.en: After many failures, he began to feel despair.
examples.zh: 经历多次失败后，他开始感到绝望。

examples.en: She fought back despair and kept studying.
examples.zh: 她压下绝望感，继续学习。

examples.en: The news filled the community with despair.
examples.zh: 这个消息让整个社区充满绝望。

definition.en: to lose hope completely.
definition.zh: 绝望；完全失去希望。

examples.en: Don’t despair—there are still options.
examples.zh: 别绝望——还有办法。

examples.en: He despaired of ever finding a better job.
examples.zh: 他对找到更好的工作感到绝望。

extraExplanation: “depair”通常是“despair”的拼写错误。正确拼写是 despair。
despair 常与介词 of 连用：despair of (doing) something，表示“对……不再抱希望”。

summary.en: De-pancreatization is a medical term for removing the pancreas or the condition of having no pancreas.
summary.zh: depancreatization 是医学术语，指切除胰腺，或指没有胰腺的状态。

definition.en: (Medical) the surgical removal of the pancreas; a state of having no pancreas.
definition.zh: （医学）胰腺切除（手术）；（结果状态）无胰腺状态。

examples.en: Total depancreatization can lead to insulin-dependent diabetes.
examples.zh: 全胰腺切除会导致胰岛素依赖型糖尿病。

examples.en: The researchers induced depancreatization in animals to study blood-sugar control.
examples.zh: 研究人员在动物身上诱导无胰腺状态，以研究血糖调控。

examples.en: After depancreatization, patients usually need enzyme replacement for digestion.
examples.zh: 胰腺切除后，患者通常需要补充消化酶来帮助消化。

extraExplanation: 这个词主要出现在医学/科研语境中，较少用于日常英语。常见的近义表达是 pancreatectomy（胰腺切除术）。
在临床上，胰腺被切除后可能同时出现两类问题：内分泌（缺乏胰岛素导致糖代谢异常）和外分泌（缺乏消化酶导致消化吸收问题），所以相关讨论常会同时提到 insulin 和 pancreatic enzymes。

summary.en: A rare medical verb meaning “to remove the pancreas (surgically).”
summary.zh: 一个少见的医学动词，意思是“（手术）切除胰腺”。

definition.en: to remove the pancreas from (a person or animal), usually by surgery; to make without a functioning pancreas
definition.zh: （通常通过手术）切除（人或动物的）胰腺；使失去胰腺功能

examples.en: The surgeon may need to depancreatize the patient to stop the spread of a tumor.
examples.zh: 外科医生可能需要为患者切除胰腺，以阻止肿瘤扩散。

examples.en: In animal studies, researchers sometimes depancreatize rats to create a model of diabetes.
examples.zh: 在动物实验中，研究人员有时会切除大鼠胰腺，以建立糖尿病模型。

extraExplanation: 这是一个非常少见、偏学术/医学的动词，来自前缀 de-（“去除、使失去”）+ pancreas（“胰腺”）+ -ize（“使成为/使…化”）。
由于胰腺分泌胰岛素并参与消化，切除胰腺后往往会出现严重的血糖调节问题（如糖尿病）以及消化酶不足，因此该词多出现在外科、病理或动物实验语境中。

summary.en: “Depardieu” usually refers to the French actor Gérard Depardieu.
summary.zh: “Depardieu”通常指法国演员热拉尔·德帕迪约。

definition.en: Gérard Depardieu: a famous French actor (and public figure), known internationally for many films; his surname is often used to refer to him or to his acting career.
definition.zh: 热拉尔·德帕迪约：法国著名演员（也是公众人物），因多部电影在国际上知名；这个姓常用来指他本人或他的演艺生涯。

examples.en: Depardieu became internationally famous through French cinema.
examples.zh: 德帕迪约通过法国电影在国际上成名。

examples.en: I watched a movie starring Depardieu last night.
examples.zh: 我昨晚看了一部德帕迪约主演的电影。

examples.en: In the article, Depardieu is described as a major figure in modern French film.
examples.zh: 文章把德帕迪约描述为现代法国电影中的重要人物。

extraExplanation: “Depardieu”通常是指法国演员 Gérard Depardieu（1948—）。在英语里提到他时，常把姓当作名字使用（和“Brad Pitt”“Meryl Streep”类似）。
他代表性作品常被英语媒体提及，例如《Green Card》（《绿卡》，1990）和《Cyrano de Bergerac》（《大鼻子情圣》，1990；法语片名也常被保留）。
作为公众人物，他也曾因个人争议登上新闻；在写作或口语中，如果语境是新闻报道，读者往往会联想到这些社会话题。

summary.en: Depark means to take a vehicle out of a parked position, or to remove a parked vehicle (sometimes by authority).
summary.zh: depark 指把车从停车状态开出/挪出，或把停放的车辆移走（有时指执法拖移）。

definition.en: to move a vehicle out of a parking space; to take it off the parked position (to unpark).
definition.zh: 把车从停车位开出；驶离停车状态（= unpark）。

examples.en: Please depark your car so the delivery truck can get through.
examples.zh: 请把车挪开（开出车位），让送货卡车通过。

examples.en: The attendant will depark the vehicles in the order they arrived.
examples.zh: 工作人员会按到达顺序把车辆依次开出来。

definition.en: to remove an illegally or inconveniently parked vehicle (often by towing or relocating it).
definition.zh: 把违规或妨碍通行的车辆移走（常指拖走或转移）。

examples.en: The city may depark cars blocking the fire lane.
examples.zh: 市政部门可能会把堵住消防通道的车移走。

extraExplanation: “depark”不是非常常见的日常用词，更常见的说法是“unpark”或更自然的表达如“move your car / pull out / back out”。在停车场管理、代客泊车（valet）或交通执法语境里，“depark”会更常出现。

summary.en: A rare verb meaning to remove someone from parliament or strip parliamentary status.
summary.zh: 一个罕见动词，指让某人退出/被除名于议会，或被剥夺议会（议员）身份。

definition.en: (Rare, nonstandard) To remove someone from membership in a parliament; to strip someone or something of parliamentary status.
definition.zh: （罕见、非标准用法）使某人不再是议会议员；剥夺某人或某机构的议会/议员身份。

examples.en: The party threatened to deparliament lawmakers who broke the voting discipline.
examples.zh: 该党威胁要把违反投票纪律的议员“取消议员资格”。

examples.en: Some critics argued the reform would deparliament independent voices.
examples.zh: 一些批评者认为这项改革会让独立声音被“剥夺议会席位”。

extraExplanation: “deparliament”并不是常见的标准英语词汇，更多像是政治写作中的临时造词（de- 表示“去除/撤销” + parliament “议会”）。在正式新闻或法律语境里，更自然的表达通常是：expel a member (from parliament)（将议员开除/除名）、strip someone of their seat（取消席位）、disqualify a lawmaker（取消资格），以及 dissolve parliament（解散议会，指机构层面）。
如果你是在某篇文章里看到它，建议结合上下文判断是“取消议员资格（对个人）”还是“削弱议会职能/议会化程度（更抽象的用法）”。

summary.en: Depart means to leave—often formally, for travel—or to deviate from a plan or rule.
summary.zh: depart 表示离开（常较正式、用于出行/时刻表），也可表示偏离计划或规则。

definition.en: to leave a place, especially to start a trip or journey
definition.zh: 离开（某地）；（尤指）启程、出发

examples.en: The train departs at 6:30 a.m.
examples.zh: 火车在早上6:30发车。

examples.en: She departed from New York for Los Angeles.
examples.zh: 她从纽约出发前往洛杉矶。

definition.en: to go away from a person or group; to take leave
definition.zh: 离去；告辞

examples.en: He thanked everyone and then departed.
examples.zh: 他向大家道谢后就离开了。

examples.en: We departed as soon as the meeting ended.
examples.zh: 会议一结束我们就离开了。

definition.en: to stop following a rule, plan, or usual way of doing something
definition.zh: 偏离；背离（规则、计划或惯常做法）

examples.en: Don’t depart from the instructions unless you are told to.
examples.zh: 除非有人告诉你，否则不要偏离说明书的步骤。

examples.en: The story departs from the original ending.
examples.zh: 这个故事偏离了原本的结局。

extraExplanation: “depart”在正式语境里很常见，尤其用于交通时刻表（depart at/from）。日常口语里，人们更常说“leave”。
固定搭配：depart for（出发去某地）、depart from（从某地出发/偏离某事）。
文学或较委婉的用法中，“depart”有时指“去世”（to depart this life），属于较正式或含蓄的表达。

summary.en: “Departed” most often means “dead (passed away)” in a formal, respectful way; it can also mean “left/went away,” the past form of “depart.”
summary.zh: “departed”最常见表示“已故的/去世的”（较正式委婉）；也可表示“离开/出发”，是“depart”的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: (especially in formal or respectful use) dead; having passed away.
definition.zh: （尤用于正式或委婉说法）去世的；已故的。

examples.en: We held a memorial for our departed friend.
examples.zh: 我们为已故的朋友举行了追思会。

examples.en: She spoke warmly of her departed parents.
examples.zh: 她深情地谈起已故的父母。

definition.en: left a place; went away (past form/participle of “depart”).
definition.zh: 离开了某地；出发了（“depart”的过去式/过去分词）。

examples.en: The train departed at 6 p.m., but we arrived late.
examples.zh: 火车下午6点出发，但我们到晚了。

examples.en: By the time I called, he had already departed for the airport.
examples.zh: 我打电话时，他已经动身去机场了。

extraExplanation: “departed”作形容词表示“已故的”时，比直接说“dead”更委婉、正式，常见于悼词、新闻报道、法律或宗教语境。
常见搭配：the departed（亡者/逝者，集合概念）；departed loved one（已故的亲人）。
在文学与影视中，“the departed”有时也可引申为“亡灵/幽魂”，语气更具叙事或神秘色彩。

summary.en: A formal word for someone who leaves a place.
summary.zh: 表示“离开某地的人”的较正式用词。

definition.en: a person who leaves a place (often used in formal, travel, or legal/immigration contexts)
definition.zh: 离开某地的人；出发者（常用于正式语境、旅行或法律/移民语境）

examples.en: Please make sure every departee has a valid boarding pass.
examples.zh: 请确认每位出发者都持有有效的登机牌。

examples.en: The notice was sent to the departee’s last known address.
examples.zh: 该通知被寄送到离境者最后已知的地址。

extraExplanation: “departee”由动词“depart（离开）”加上表示“……的人”的后缀“-ee”构成，类似的词还有“employee（雇员）”“refugee（难民）”。在日常英语里，人们更常说“departing passenger”“traveler”“person leaving”，而“departee”更偏正式或法律/行政文书。

summary.en: A department is an organization’s division or an area of responsibility/knowledge.
summary.zh: department 指组织中的“部门/系/处”，也可指某个“职责或擅长的领域”。

definition.en: A division of an organization (such as a company, university, or government) that focuses on a particular area of work.
definition.zh: （公司、学校、政府等的）部门；系；处（负责某一类工作）

examples.en: She works in the marketing department.
examples.zh: 她在市场部工作。

examples.en: The Department of Health announced new guidelines.
examples.zh: 卫生部公布了新的指导方针。

definition.en: A particular area of knowledge, responsibility, or activity.
definition.zh: （知识、职责或活动的）领域；方面

examples.en: Cooking isn’t really my department.
examples.zh: 做饭不是我擅长的领域。

examples.en: Customer service is his department.
examples.zh: 客户服务是他的职责范围。

extraExplanation: “departement”常见于拼写错误或受法语拼写影响；英语标准拼写是 **department**。
在美国英语里，政府机构常用 “the Department of …” 表示“……部/署”（如 Department of Education）。在英国英语中，有时也会用 “ministry”。

summary.en: “Departments” means separate divisions in an organization (and can also mean university subject groups; in a French context it can refer to France’s administrative areas).
summary.zh: “Departments”指组织中的各个部门（也可指大学院系；在法国语境中也可指法国的行政区“省/部门”）。

definition.en: separate divisions or sections of an organization, company, store, or government, each with its own area of work
definition.zh: （组织、公司、商店或政府的）部门；分部，各自负责不同工作

examples.en: She works in the sales department.
examples.zh: 她在销售部门工作。

examples.en: Please contact our customer service department.
examples.zh: 请联系我们的客服部门。

examples.en: The store has a men’s clothing department on the second floor.
examples.zh: 这家店二楼有男装部。

definition.en: groups within a school or university that teach and study a particular subject
definition.zh: （学校或大学的）系；学科部门

examples.en: He joined the English department at the university.
examples.zh: 他加入了那所大学的英语系。

examples.en: The department offers courses in psychology and sociology.
examples.zh: 这个系开设心理学和社会学课程。

definition.en: (also used in English) administrative areas in France, similar to “counties”
definition.zh: （法语语境中也常见）法国的行政区“省/部门”（类似“郡/县”的层级）

examples.en: Paris is in the Île-de-France region, not a single department.
examples.zh: 巴黎属于法兰西岛大区，并不等同于一个单独的“省/部门”（department）。

examples.en: Some maps label French departments with numbers.
examples.zh: 有些地图会用数字标注法国各“省/部门”。

extraExplanation: 你输入的 **departements** 通常是拼写变体或拼写错误：英语里更常见的复数是 **departments**。
**département(s)** 是法语词，在法国语境里指行政区划；在英语里也会借用这个概念，但拼写通常仍写 **department(s)**。

summary.en: Departer means a person who leaves or sets off from a place.
summary.zh: departer 指离开某地、启程出发的人。

definition.en: a person who leaves a place (especially someone departing on a trip)
definition.zh: 离开某地的人；出发者（尤指启程旅行的人）

examples.en: Please check in at the desk 30 minutes before boarding, departers.
examples.zh: 请在登机前30分钟到柜台办理手续，出发的旅客。

examples.en: The station was crowded with departers and greeters.
examples.zh: 车站里挤满了出发者和送行的人。

extraExplanation: “departer”是比较少见的名词形式，日常英语里更常用的是“passenger / traveler / departing passenger / people who are leaving”。在机场或车站广播中，也更常见“departing passengers（即将出发的乘客）”。

summary.en: “Departing” means “leaving” or “about to leave,” especially for trips; it is also the -ing form of “depart.”
summary.zh: “departing”表示“离开的/即将出发的”，常用于交通出行场景；也可作“depart”的-ing形式。

definition.en: leaving a place; about to go away (often used in travel contexts).
definition.zh: 离开的；即将出发的（常用于旅行/交通场景）。

examples.en: The departing train will leave from platform 3.
examples.zh: 即将出发的火车将从3号站台发车。

examples.en: Please have your passport ready for departing passengers.
examples.zh: 请出境（即将离境）的旅客准备好护照。

definition.en: the present participle of “depart”: leaving; going away from a place, or starting a journey.
definition.zh: “depart”的现在分词：离开；出发。

examples.en: We saw her departing the office at 6 p.m.
examples.zh: 我们看到她晚上六点离开办公室。

examples.en: The plane is departing in ten minutes.
examples.zh: 飞机十分钟后起飞。

extraExplanation: 在机场/车站常见的对照是 Arrivals（到达）与 Departures（出发/离境）。“departing passengers”通常指即将离境或登机/登车的旅客。
注意搭配：depart from + 地点（从某地离开）；depart for + 目的地（出发去某地）。例如：The bus departs from Gate 5 and departs for Boston.

summary.en: Departingly means “as someone leaves” or (rarely) “in a way that departs from the usual.”
summary.zh: departingly 指“离去时/带着告别意味地”，（罕见）也可指“以偏离常规的方式”。

definition.en: In a way that involves leaving or going away; at the time of departure.
definition.zh: 以离开、告别的方式；在启程或离去之时。

examples.en: She waved departingly from the station platform.
examples.zh: 她在站台上以告别的姿态挥手。

examples.en: He spoke departingly, as if he already had one foot out the door.
examples.zh: 他说话带着要走的意味，仿佛已经一脚踏出门外。

definition.en: (Rare) In a manner that marks a departure from the usual; differently in an unexpected way.
definition.zh: （罕见）以偏离常规的方式；出乎意料地不同。

examples.en: The poem ends departingly, shifting from calm description to sudden doubt.
examples.zh: 这首诗的结尾很“转向”，从平静描写突然转为怀疑。

extraExplanation: “departingly”在现代英语里非常少见，更常用的表达是“in a departing way / as (someone) departs / upon leaving”。
它来自“depart（离开；偏离）+ -ing + -ly”，因此既可能表达“离去时的样子”，也可能引申为“与平常不同（a departure from the norm）”，但第二种用法更偏文学或评论语境。

summary.en: “departir” is Spanish (not standard English): it means “to distribute” and sometimes “to converse.”
summary.zh: “departir”是西班牙语（非标准英语）：常指“分配”，有时也指“交谈”。

definition.en: (Not standard English) A Spanish verb meaning “to distribute; to share out.”
definition.zh: （非标准英语）西班牙语动词，意为“分配；分发；分摊”。

examples.en: In Spanish, *departir* can mean “to distribute” resources fairly.
examples.zh: 在西班牙语中，*departir* 可以表示“公平地分配”资源。

examples.en: The charity aims to *departir* food among families in need. (Spanish usage)
examples.zh: 这个慈善机构希望把食物*分配*给有需要的家庭。（西语用法）

definition.en: (Not standard English) In some Spanish contexts, it can also mean “to converse; to chat (often formally).”
definition.zh: （非标准英语）在某些西班牙语语境中，也可表示“交谈；闲谈（常带较正式的语气）”。

examples.en: They sat down to *departir* about politics and literature. (Spanish usage)
examples.zh: 他们坐下来*谈论*政治和文学。（西语用法）

examples.en: After the meeting, the guests stayed to *departir* for a while. (Spanish usage)
examples.zh: 会议结束后，客人们又留下来*聊*了一会儿。（西语用法）

extraExplanation: “departir”是西班牙语，不是英语单词；如果你是在英文文本里看到它，常见情况是：作者在引用西语原词、或在讨论西语文学/历史材料。
发音这里用“给英语使用者的近似读法”表示；真正的西语发音会带颤音 r（类似轻微的弹舌）。

summary.en: Departisanize means to remove party politics or party bias from something, making it more neutral.
summary.zh: departisanize 指“去政党化”，即减少党派政治或党派偏见，使其更中立。

definition.en: to remove strong party politics or party bias from something (such as a process, institution, or discussion); to make it less tied to any political party
definition.zh: 使（某事物）去政党化；减少党派色彩或党派偏见（如让制度、机构或讨论不再明显偏向某一政党）

examples.en: The committee was created to departisanize the redistricting process.
examples.zh: 该委员会的设立是为了让选区重划过程去党派化。

examples.en: They tried to departisanize the debate by focusing on data instead of slogans.
examples.zh: 他们试图通过关注数据而不是口号，让辩论去党派化。

extraExplanation: 这个词由 de-（去除）+ partisan（党派的/党派人士）+ -ize（使……化）构成，常见于政治、公共管理与媒体语境，尤其用于讨论“让某项政策或程序更中立、更专业”。
在实际写作中，它通常搭配抽象名词：departisanize the courts/education/public service/elections（让法院/教育/公务体系/选举去党派化）。

summary.en: Departition means dividing something into separate parts or departments, mainly in organizational contexts.
summary.zh: Departition 指把某物划分成不同部分或部门，常见于组织管理语境。

definition.en: the act or process of dividing something into separate parts, sections, or departments (especially for organization or administration).
definition.zh: 将某物划分为不同部分、区段或部门的行为或过程（尤指为了组织或管理）。

examples.en: The company’s departition created three new departments: sales, support, and research.
examples.zh: 公司的部门划分新增了三个部门：销售、客服和研发。

examples.en: After the departition of responsibilities, each team knew exactly what to do.
examples.zh: 责任划分后，每个团队都清楚自己的工作。

extraExplanation: “departition”在现代英语中非常少见，很多场合更常用“division”“partition”或“departmentalization”（部门化/按部门组织）。如果你是在正式文件或学术文本里看到它，通常就是“把组织/职责划分成多个部分或部门”的意思。
注意不要和“deportation”（驱逐出境）混淆；拼写和发音相近，但含义完全不同。

summary.en: “Department” most commonly means a section of an organization; it can also mean an aspect/area ("in the ___ department") or a store section.
summary.zh: “department”最常指机构中的“部门/系”；也可指某事的“方面”（in the ___ department），或商店里的“分区/专柜”。

definition.en: A division of an organization (such as a company, university, or government) that focuses on a particular area of work.
definition.zh: （公司、大学、政府等机构的）部门；负责某一类工作的单位。

examples.en: Please contact the HR department about your benefits.
examples.zh: 关于福利请联系人力资源部。

examples.en: She works in the marketing department.
examples.zh: 她在市场部工作。

examples.en: The university’s English department offers teacher-training programs.
examples.zh: 这所大学的英语系提供教师培训项目。

definition.en: A specific field, area, or aspect of a subject or activity (often used in the phrase “in the ___ department”).
definition.zh: （某个主题/活动的）方面、领域（常用于 “in the ___ department” 表达）。

examples.en: He’s strong in the technical department but needs help with communication.
examples.zh: 他在技术方面很强，但沟通方面需要加强。

examples.en: This phone is great in the battery-life department.
examples.zh: 这款手机在续航方面很出色。

definition.en: A part of a large store that sells a particular type of goods (often in “department store”).
definition.zh: （大型商店的）专柜/分区；售卖某一类商品的区域（常见于 “department store” 百货商店）。

examples.en: The shoes are in the women’s department on the second floor.
examples.zh: 鞋子在二楼的女装区。

examples.en: He went to the electronics department to buy headphones.
examples.zh: 他去电子产品区买耳机。

extraExplanation: 用法提示：在学校里常说“the History Department / the English Department”，相当于“历史系/英语系”。在公司里更常对应“部门”（如 Finance Department 财务部、Sales Department 销售部）。
常见搭配：department head（部门主管）、department meeting（部门会议）、departmental（adj. 部门的，如 departmental policy 部门政策）。
与“division/section/unit”区别：department 通常更正式、更固定；division 常指更大的事业部或更高层级划分；section/unit 常指更小的组或科室。

summary.en: “Departmental” means “related to a department in an organization.”
summary.zh: departmental 表示“与组织中的某个部门有关的；部门的”。

definition.en: Related to a department (a division of an organization such as a company, university, or government).
definition.zh: 与“部门”有关的；部门的（指公司、大学或政府等组织中的一个分支）。

examples.en: All departmental meetings are held on Mondays.
examples.zh: 所有部门会议都在周一举行。

examples.en: She submitted a departmental budget request.
examples.zh: 她提交了一份部门预算申请。

extraExplanation: 在大学或机构中，departmental 常用来形容“部门层级”的事务或决定，强调它属于某个具体系/处/科室，而不是“全校/全公司层级”的（例如 departmental policy vs. university-wide policy）。
常见搭配：departmental meeting（部门会议）、departmental policy（部门政策）、departmental budget（部门预算）、departmental approval（部门批准）、departmental store（百货商店——但更常用 department store；departmental store 较少见）。

summary.en: Departmentalisation means organizing an organization into separate departments with different responsibilities.
summary.zh: departmentalisation 指把一个组织按职能划分为不同部门，以分工负责。

definition.en: the organization of a company, school, or government into separate departments, each responsible for a specific area of work
definition.zh: （公司、学校或政府的）部门化；按职能划分为不同部门的组织方式

examples.en: As the company grew, departmentalisation helped clarify who was responsible for sales, finance, and customer support.
examples.zh: 随着公司发展壮大，部门化帮助明确了销售、财务和客服各自的职责。

examples.en: The report recommends departmentalisation to improve efficiency and reduce confusion.
examples.zh: 报告建议实行部门化，以提高效率并减少混乱。

extraExplanation: “departmentalisation”多见于英式拼写；美式拼写通常为“departmentalization”。两者意思相同。
这是管理学/组织结构讨论中的常用术语，常与“centralisation（集中化）”“decentralisation（分权/分散化）”对比。

summary.en: Departmentalise means to divide work or an organization into separate departments; it can also mean separating issues into categories, sometimes too rigidly.
summary.zh: departmentalise 指将组织或工作按职能划分为不同部门；也可指把问题分门别类地割裂处理，有时带“过度分割”的含义。

definition.en: to organize something into separate departments, each responsible for a particular area of work
definition.zh: 把（某事物）按职能划分为不同部门，并由各部门分别负责

examples.en: The company decided to departmentalise its customer service operations.
examples.zh: 公司决定将客户服务业务按部门进行划分。

examples.en: As the organization grew, tasks became departmentalised to improve efficiency.
examples.zh: 随着组织规模扩大，为提高效率，任务被部门化分工。

definition.en: to treat something as belonging to one category or area, separate from others (often implying that connections are being ignored)
definition.zh: 把（想法/问题等）归入某一类并与其他部分隔开来看（常含“忽视关联”的意味）

examples.en: It’s hard to solve the problem if we departmentalise it and ignore how the issues are connected.
examples.zh: 如果我们把问题部门化、各看各的而忽视彼此联系，就很难解决。

extraExplanation: departmentalise 是英式拼写；美式更常写作 departmentalize。两者意思相同，只是拼写习惯不同。
在管理与组织语境里，它常与“分工、流程、职责边界”相关；有时也带一点负面含义，暗示“各部门各自为政、缺乏协作”。

summary.en: “Departmentalised” means divided into departments, or (often critically) focused only on one department’s perspective.
summary.zh: “departmentalised”指“部门化的、按部门划分的”，也可（常含批评）指“只顾本部门立场的”。

definition.en: (BrE) Organized into separate departments or sections; divided so that work and responsibility are handled by different units.
definition.zh: （英式）部门化的；按不同部门/科室划分并分工负责的。

examples.en: The company is highly departmentalised, so you may need to contact HR instead of your manager.
examples.zh: 这家公司高度部门化，所以你可能需要联系人力资源部，而不是你的直属经理。

examples.en: A departmentalised system can improve efficiency, but it may also slow down communication.
examples.zh: 部门化的体系可以提高效率，但也可能让沟通变慢。

definition.en: Limited to one department’s viewpoint; not considering the whole organization (often a criticism).
definition.zh: （常含批评）只从本部门角度出发的；本位主义的。

examples.en: Their planning was too departmentalised, and the teams didn’t share information.
examples.zh: 他们的规划太“部门本位”了，各团队之间没有共享信息。

examples.en: To solve the problem, we need a less departmentalised approach and more collaboration.
examples.zh: 要解决这个问题，我们需要减少部门本位，多一些协作。

extraExplanation: “departmentalised”更常见于英式拼写；美式通常写作“departmentalized”。
这个词多用于组织管理语境（公司、政府、医院、大学等）。有时是中性描述“按部门分工”，有时带批评意味，指“各自为政、信息孤岛”。

summary.en: Departmentalising means dividing work or an organization into separate departments, sometimes creating “silos.”
summary.zh: departmentalising 指把工作或组织按部门进行划分与分工，有时暗含形成“部门墙/信息孤岛”的问题。

definition.en: organizing an organization, system, or work into separate departments; dividing responsibilities into departmental units
definition.zh: 把组织、系统或工作划分为不同部门；将职责按部门进行分工

examples.en: The company is departmentalising its customer support so each team specializes in one product line.
examples.zh: 公司正在将客服工作部门化，让每个团队专门负责一条产品线。

examples.en: Departmentalising the project can make reporting clearer, but it may slow communication across teams.
examples.zh: 把项目部门化能让汇报更清晰，但也可能让跨团队沟通变慢。

definition.en: (more abstract) treating a problem or idea as separate “silos,” rather than as a connected whole
definition.zh: （更抽象）把问题或想法切割成互不相干的“孤岛”，而不是作为整体来处理

examples.en: We keep departmentalising the issue—finance looks only at cost while HR looks only at hiring.
examples.zh: 我们总是在把问题部门化——财务只看成本，人力只看招聘。

extraExplanation: “departmentalising”是英式拼写；美式常写作“departmentalizing”。两者意思相同，常用于管理、组织架构与流程设计语境。
这个词有时带一点批评意味，接近“siloing（形成部门墙）”，强调部门之间缺乏协作。

summary.en: Departmentalism is a narrow focus on one’s own department that harms cross-team cooperation.
summary.zh: departmentalism 指只顾本部门利益的倾向，往往损害跨部门协作。

definition.en: A tendency for people to focus mainly on their own department or group, often leading to poor cooperation with others.
definition.zh: 部门本位主义：人们主要只关注自己所在部门或小团体的利益与目标，常导致与其他部门协作不佳。

examples.en: Departmentalism can slow down a company because teams refuse to share information.
examples.zh: 部门本位主义会拖慢公司效率，因为各团队不愿共享信息。

examples.en: The new manager tried to reduce departmentalism by setting shared goals for all departments.
examples.zh: 新经理试图通过为所有部门设定共同目标来减少部门本位主义。

extraExplanation: 这个词常出现在组织管理与政府行政语境里，强调“各自为政、各管一摊”的问题。它与“silo mentality（信息孤岛思维）”“turf wars（地盘之争）”含义接近。
在职场写作中，它通常带负面评价，用来解释沟通成本高、流程卡顿、跨部门项目失败等现象。

summary.en: Departmentalization means organizing an organization into departments, or the resulting departmental structure.
summary.zh: departmentalization 指把组织划分为不同部门的过程，或由此形成的部门结构。

definition.en: The process of organizing a company or institution into separate departments, each responsible for a particular type of work.
definition.zh: （组织的）部门化；按职能/产品/地区等把机构划分为不同部门的过程。

examples.en: The company’s rapid growth required departmentalization to keep teams focused.
examples.zh: 公司的快速增长需要进行部门化，以让各团队保持专注。

examples.en: Departmentalization by function often creates groups like marketing, finance, and HR.
examples.zh: 按职能进行部门化通常会形成市场、财务和人力资源等部门。

definition.en: The structure or system that results from dividing an organization into departments.
definition.zh: 部门设置；部门划分后的组织结构/体系。

examples.en: In our school’s departmentalization, science and math are managed separately.
examples.zh: 在我们学校的部门设置中，理科和数学由不同部门分别管理。

examples.en: Poor departmentalization can slow decisions because information gets stuck between departments.
examples.zh: 不良的部门设置可能会拖慢决策，因为信息会卡在部门之间。

extraExplanation: “departmentalization”常见于管理学与商业英语。常见类型包括：按职能（functional）、按产品（product）、按地区（geographical）、按客户（customer）以及矩阵式（matrix，兼顾两个维度）。不同划分方式的取舍通常与沟通成本、专业化程度与协调难度有关。

summary.en: To departmentalize means to divide an organization or work into separate departments, or to separate tasks/ideas into distinct categories.
summary.zh: departmentalize 指把组织或工作按部门划分；也可指把任务/想法分开归类处理。

definition.en: to organize a company, institution, or work process into separate departments, each with its own responsibilities
definition.zh: 把（公司、机构或工作流程）按“部门”来划分与管理，使各部门分工明确

examples.en: The hospital decided to departmentalize its services into surgery, pediatrics, and emergency care.
examples.zh: 这家医院决定把服务按部门划分为外科、儿科和急诊。

examples.en: As the startup grew, they began to departmentalize hiring, finance, and customer support.
examples.zh: 随着初创公司壮大，他们开始把招聘、财务和客服分设为不同部门。

definition.en: to separate tasks or ideas into distinct categories, often to keep them from affecting each other (similar to “compartmentalize”)
definition.zh: 把任务或想法分开处理、分门别类（常指避免彼此影响，类似“compartmentalize”）

examples.en: To stay calm, she tried to departmentalize work stress and family time.
examples.zh: 为了保持平静，她尽量把工作压力和家庭时间分开处理。

examples.en: Good managers can departmentalize problems and deal with them one at a time.
examples.zh: 优秀的管理者能把问题分门别类，然后逐个解决。

extraExplanation: 常见使用场景在组织管理与流程设计中：departmentalize 强调“按部门结构来划分”，比 divide 更正式、也更有管理含义。
英式拼写为 departmentalise（-ise 结尾），美式拼写更常见 departmentalize（-ize 结尾）。
和 compartmentalize 的区别：departmentalize 多用于“组织/机构层面的部门化”；compartmentalize 更常用于“把事情/情绪/想法隔离开”的心理或抽象语境。

summary.en: “Departmentalized” means organized into separate departments; it can also suggest work is split into silos.
summary.zh: “departmentalized”指按部门划分、分工明确；也可带有“割裂成信息孤岛、不易协作”的含义。

definition.en: (Of an organization, company, or system) divided into separate departments, each responsible for a specific area of work.
definition.zh: （指组织、公司或系统）按部门划分的；分成不同部门、各自负责特定工作的。

examples.en: The company is highly departmentalized, so you may need to contact several teams to solve one problem.
examples.zh: 这家公司部门划分非常细，所以解决一个问题可能需要联系好几个团队。

examples.en: In a departmentalized school, teachers belong to different subject departments like math or English.
examples.zh: 在按部门划分的学校里，老师会隶属于不同学科的教研组，比如数学组或英语组。

definition.en: (Often about work or thinking) separated into strict categories, sometimes making cooperation difficult.
definition.zh: （常指工作或思维方式）被严格分割成不同类别的；可能导致协作不畅的。

examples.en: The process feels too departmentalized—no one sees the whole customer experience.
examples.zh: 这个流程太“按部门切割”了——没有人能看到完整的客户体验。

examples.en: They criticized the departmentalized approach because it created silos.
examples.zh: 他们批评这种按部门割裂的做法，因为它造成了信息孤岛。

extraExplanation: “departmentalized”常见于商业管理和组织结构讨论中，强调把工作按职能（如市场、财务、人力资源）或按产品/地区来分组。优点是分工明确、专业化；缺点是容易形成“silos（信息孤岛）”，跨部门沟通成本高。
也可视作动词“departmentalize”的过去分词/形容词用法：to departmentalize = 把……按部门划分。

summary.en: “Departmentalizes” means organizes something into separate departments/divisions; it can also mean mentally keeping areas of life or feelings separate.
summary.zh: “departmentalizes”表示把事物按部门/职能划分来组织；也可指在心理上把生活领域或情绪分隔开。

definition.en: to organize something into separate departments or divisions, each with its own responsibilities
definition.zh: 把某事按“部门/分工”来划分与组织，使其分成不同部门（或职能单位），各自负责不同事务

examples.en: The company departmentalizes its operations into sales, marketing, and customer support.
examples.zh: 这家公司把业务按销售、市场和客服等部门来划分管理。

examples.en: She departmentalizes the workflow so each team knows exactly what to do.
examples.zh: 她把工作流程按职能分拆，让每个团队都清楚自己该做什么。

definition.en: (often in psychology) to keep different parts of life or feelings separate in your mind, so they don’t affect each other
definition.zh: （常用于心理学语境）在心理上把生活的不同部分或情绪“分隔开”，让它们彼此不影响

examples.en: Some people departmentalize stress at work so it doesn’t spill into family life.
examples.zh: 有些人会把工作的压力在心理上分隔开，不让它影响家庭生活。

examples.en: He tries to departmentalize his grief and stay focused during the day.
examples.zh: 他试着把悲伤“放在一边”，白天保持专注。

extraExplanation: “departmentalizes”是动词“departmentalize”的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it departmentalizes）。也常见名词形式：departmentalization（部门化、按部门划分）。

summary.en: Departmentalizing means dividing work or an organization into separate departments by function.
summary.zh: departmentalizing 指把工作或组织按职能划分成不同部门。

definition.en: to divide an organization, system, or work into separate departments (groups) that each handle a specific function
definition.zh: 将一个组织、系统或工作划分为不同的部门（分组），让各部门分别负责特定职能

examples.en: The company is departmentalizing its customer service team into billing, technical support, and returns.
examples.zh: 公司正在把客服团队部门化，分成账单、技术支持和退货处理。

examples.en: As the school grows, it’s departmentalizing staff responsibilities to improve efficiency.
examples.zh: 随着学校规模扩大，它正在将员工职责部门化，以提高效率。

definition.en: (in process writing) the act of organizing tasks or information by department or function
definition.zh: （在流程/管理写作中）按部门或职能来组织任务或信息的做法

examples.en: Departmentalizing the report makes it easier to assign sections to different managers.
examples.zh: 把报告按部门来组织更容易把不同部分分配给不同经理。

examples.en: They recommended departmentalizing the workflow to reduce confusion.
examples.zh: 他们建议将工作流程部门化，以减少混乱。

extraExplanation: “departmentalize”常见于商业管理与组织结构讨论，强调按“职能”（如财务、人力、市场）或按“产品/地区”来分组。它通常暗示一种更正式、更清晰的分工。
拼写上美式英语常见 departmentalize（-ize），英式英语也可能见到 departmentalise（-ise）。

summary.en: “Departmentally” means “by departments” or “within each department separately.”
summary.zh: “Departmentally”表示“按部门（分别）地；在各部门内部地”。

definition.en: In a way that is organized by departments, or separately within each department (especially in a company, school, or government).
definition.zh: 以（各）部门为单位地；在各部门内部（分别）地（常用于公司、学校或政府等组织结构中）。

examples.en: Training is handled departmentally, so each team teaches its own procedures.
examples.zh: 培训是按部门来负责的，所以每个团队都会教自己的流程。

examples.en: The budget is planned departmentally before the finance office combines it.
examples.zh: 预算先由各部门分别制定，然后财务部门再汇总。

extraExplanation: “Departmentally”多用于正式或书面语，常见于组织管理语境，强调“分部门各自处理”，有时也带有“缺乏跨部门协作、各自为政”的暗示，需根据上下文判断语气。

summary.en: Departmentization means organizing an organization into departments, or the structure used to group work into departments.
summary.zh: Departmentization 指把组织划分为不同部门的过程，或这种部门划分的结构方式。

definition.en: the process of organizing an organization into separate departments based on function, product, customer, geography, etc.
definition.zh: （组织的）部门化；将组织按职能、产品、客户、地区等划分为不同部门的过程

examples.en: The company’s departmentization improved communication by clarifying who was responsible for each task.
examples.zh: 这家公司的部门化通过明确各项任务的责任人，提高了沟通效率。

examples.en: During rapid growth, departmentization helps managers control work and set clearer reporting lines.
examples.zh: 在快速增长时期，部门化有助于管理者控制工作并建立更清晰的汇报关系。

definition.en: a particular way (structure) of grouping jobs and people into departments
definition.zh: 部门划分方式；把岗位与人员分组为各部门的一种组织结构安排

examples.en: Their departmentization is product-based, so each product line has its own marketing and sales teams.
examples.zh: 他们采用以产品为基础的部门划分方式，因此每条产品线都有自己的市场与销售团队。

examples.en: Geographic departmentization can work well for businesses with regional differences.
examples.zh: 对于存在明显地区差异的企业，按地区部门化往往很有效。

extraExplanation: “departmentization”多用于管理学/组织结构语境；更常见、更标准的拼写是“departmentalization”，含义基本相同。
常见类型包括：按职能（functional）、按产品（product）、按客户（customer）、按地区（geographic）、按流程/项目（process/project）部门化。不同类型会影响协作方式、成本控制与决策速度。

summary.en: Departmentize means to divide an organization into departments for different functions.
summary.zh: Departmentize 指将组织按不同职能划分为各个部门。

definition.en: to organize (a company, school, government office, etc.) into separate departments, each responsible for a specific area of work
definition.zh: 将（公司、学校、政府机构等）按职能划分为不同部门，使各部门负责各自的工作

examples.en: The new manager decided to departmentize the sales team by region.
examples.zh: 新经理决定把销售团队按地区进行部门化管理。

examples.en: As the company grew, it became necessary to departmentize operations like HR, finance, and marketing.
examples.zh: 随着公司发展壮大，有必要把人力资源、财务和市场等运营工作部门化。

extraExplanation: “departmentize”常用于组织管理与企业运营语境，强调“按职能/领域划分结构”。在更日常的英语中，人们也常说“organize into departments”或“divide into departments”。
构词上：department（部门）+ -ize（使……化/使成为……），与“modernize（现代化）”“centralize（集中化）”的构词方式类似。

summary.en: Departments are parts of an organization that do specific work; it can also mean an area or field of activity.
summary.zh: departments 指组织里负责特定工作的“部门”，也可指某个“领域/方面”。

definition.en: A main division of an organization (such as a company, university, hospital, or government) that handles a particular kind of work.
definition.zh: （组织中的）部门；负责某一类工作的主要分支（如公司、大学、医院或政府机构）。

examples.en: She works in the marketing department.
examples.zh: 她在市场部工作。

examples.en: The hospital’s emergency department is very busy at night.
examples.zh: 这家医院的急诊科晚上非常忙。

examples.en: Please contact the customer service department for help.
examples.zh: 请联系客户服务部门寻求帮助。

definition.en: A category or area of knowledge, activity, or life.
definition.zh: （知识、活动或生活的）领域；方面。

examples.en: Math is not my strongest department.
examples.zh: 数学不是我最擅长的领域。

examples.en: In the parenting department, patience really matters.
examples.zh: 在育儿这方面，耐心非常重要。

extraExplanation: “departments”是“department”的复数形式。常见缩写有Dept.（部门）与ED（emergency department，急诊科）。
在英式英语里，大学里的“department”常指系（如Department of History 历史系）；在公司语境中多译为“部门”。

summary.en: “Departs” means “leaves/sets off,” and it can also mean “deviates from” (from a rule or plan) or, formally, “dies.”
summary.zh: “departs”意为“离开/出发”；也可指“偏离（规则/计划）”；正式语境中还可委婉表示“去世”。

definition.en: (3rd person singular of “depart”) to leave, especially to start a journey or go away from a place.
definition.zh: （“depart”的第三人称单数）离开；出发（尤指启程、离开某地）。

examples.en: The train departs at 7:30 a.m.
examples.zh: 火车上午7:30发车。

examples.en: He departs tomorrow for New York.
examples.zh: 他明天动身去纽约。

definition.en: to differ from or move away from a rule, plan, or usual way of doing something (often used with “from”).
definition.zh: 偏离；背离（常与 from 连用，指偏离规则、计划或惯常做法）。

examples.en: The new policy departs from our original agreement.
examples.zh: 新政策背离了我们最初的协议。

examples.en: Try not to depart from the topic during your presentation.
examples.zh: 演讲时尽量不要偏离主题。

definition.en: (formal) to die; to pass away.
definition.zh: （正式/委婉）去世；离世。

examples.en: She departed this life peacefully.
examples.zh: 她安详离世。

examples.en: The poet departed at the age of eighty.
examples.zh: 那位诗人在八十岁时去世。

extraExplanation: “departs”通常出现在时间表/公告中（如火车、航班、公交）：The flight departs at…；更口语的说法常用“leaves”。
“depart from”表示“偏离”，语气比“change”更强调“不按原来/常规来”。
表示“去世”的用法较正式，常见于讣告、文学或庄重语境；日常口语更常用“die”或“pass away”。

summary.en: “Departure” most commonly means leaving or the time of leaving; it can also mean a significant change from the usual or planned way.
summary.zh: departure 最常指“离开/出发及其时间”，也可指“偏离常规或计划的重大改变”。

definition.en: the act of leaving a place; the time or moment when someone or something leaves
definition.zh: 离开；出发；（车/船/飞机等的）起程时间

examples.en: Our departure is scheduled for 8:30 a.m.
examples.zh: 我们定于上午8:30出发。

examples.en: She waved goodbye at his departure.
examples.zh: 他离开时，她挥手告别。

examples.en: Please arrive two hours before departure.
examples.zh: 请在起飞/出发前两小时到达。

definition.en: a change from what is usual, expected, or planned
definition.zh: 背离常规；偏离；（与预期/计划的）出入

examples.en: The new policy marks a major departure from tradition.
examples.zh: 这项新政策标志着对传统的重大改变。

examples.en: His tone was a departure from his usual calm manner.
examples.zh: 他的语气一反平日的冷静。

extraExplanation: 在旅行语境里，departure 常与 arrival（到达）成对出现，也常见于机场/车站信息：Departures（出发/离境航班），Departure gate（登机口），Departure time（起飞/发车时间）。
在写作或评论中，departure from... 是一个常用搭配，表示“与……不同/偏离……”，语气比 change 更正式、更强调“脱离原有模式”。

summary.en: “Departures” most often means times or events of leaving (especially flights/trains). It can also mean a change away from what is normal: “a departure from tradition.”
summary.zh: “departures”最常指离开/出发（尤指航班、列车的出发时刻或班次）；也可指背离常规，如“departure from tradition（背离传统）”。

definition.en: the act of leaving a place, especially the time or moment when someone or something leaves
definition.zh: 离开；出发（尤指离开的时间或时刻）

examples.en: Our flight’s departure is at 9:40 a.m.
examples.zh: 我们的航班起飞时间是上午9:40。

examples.en: There were several departures from the station this morning.
examples.zh: 今天早上车站有好几班出发。

definition.en: a difference from what is usual or expected; a change away from a standard, plan, or tradition
definition.zh: 背离常规；偏离（标准、计划或传统）

examples.en: The new design is a departure from the company’s usual style.
examples.zh: 这个新设计背离了公司一贯的风格。

examples.en: Any departure from the rules will be reported.
examples.zh: 任何违反规定的行为都会被上报。

extraExplanation: “departures”常见于机场/车站信息牌：Arrivals（到达） vs. Departures（出发）。在这种场景里，departures几乎总是指“出发的航班/列车（及其时刻）”。
抽象用法“a departure from …”很常见，表示“偏离/不同于……”。注意这里departure不是“出发”，而是“背离、变化”。

summary.en: “Depas” is not a standard English word; it’s likely a typo or a French-related form meaning “exceed/go beyond.”
summary.zh: “depas”不是标准英语单词；多半是拼写错误或与法语相关、表示“超过/超出”的形式。

definition.en: Not a standard English word. It is most likely a misspelling or a non-English form (often seen as French “dépas-” from dépasser, meaning “to go beyond / exceed”).
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词。更可能是拼写错误或外来语形式（常见于法语“dépas-”，来自 dépasser，意为“超过/超出”）。

examples.en: I can’t find “depas” in an English dictionary—did you mean “depass” or “depict”?
examples.zh: 我在英语词典里找不到“depas”——你是想写“depass”还是“depict”吗？

examples.en: If you meant the French root “dépas-,” it relates to “exceed” (go beyond a limit).
examples.zh: 如果你指的是法语词根“dépas-”，它和“exceed（超过限制）”有关。

extraExplanation:
在英语里，“depas”本身不常用，通常需要看上下文判断你真正想表达的词。可能的目标词：
1) **depict**（vt. 描绘/描述）：常用于写作与艺术语境。
2) **depass / dépassé**（更偏法语或非常少见的英语借用）：表示“超过”或“过时的”。英语里更常用 **exceed / surpass / outdated**。
如果你把原句发出来（含前后文），我可以帮你定位最合适的英文词。

summary.en: De­pascent means “grazing or feeding,” used rarely and formally.
summary.zh: depascent 意为“正在放牧/取食的”，用法罕见且较正式。

definition.en: (rare, formal) Feeding or grazing (especially animals feeding on plants).
definition.zh: （罕见，正式）正在取食或放牧的；（尤指）动物啃食植物的。

examples.en: Deer were depascent in the meadow at dusk.
examples.zh: 黄昏时，鹿群在草地上取食。

examples.en: The botanist noted depascent cattle had stripped the young shoots.
examples.zh: 植物学家注意到，放牧的牛把嫩芽都啃掉了。

extraExplanation: “depascent”非常少见，多见于较老的自然史、博物学或技术性写作中，用来强调动物在植物上“取食/啃食”的状态。
词源可追溯到拉丁语 *depascere*（吃尽、啃食），与 *pasture*（牧场/放牧）同源。现代英语更常用 *grazing*（吃草的）或 *feeding*（进食的）来表达。

summary.en: “Depass” is a rare verb meaning “to go beyond; to exceed; to surpass.”
summary.zh: “depass”是一个罕用动词，意思是“超出/超过/胜过”。

definition.en: (rare) To go beyond; to exceed a limit or standard; to surpass.
definition.zh: （罕用）超出；超过（界限或标准）；胜过。

examples.en: The river depassed its banks after days of heavy rain.
examples.zh: 连日暴雨后，河水漫过了河岸。

examples.en: Her performance depassed everyone’s expectations.
examples.zh: 她的表现超出了所有人的预期。

extraExplanation: “depass”在现代英语中非常少见，更多出现在较老的文本或受法语影响的写作里。日常写作与口语更常用：exceed（超出/超过）、surpass（胜过）、go beyond（超越）。
注意拼写：不要与“trespass（擅闯/侵入）”混淆。

summary.en: Depasturable means suitable for grazing or able to be used as pasture.
summary.zh: depasturable 指“可放牧的、适合放牧的（可作牧场使用的）”。

definition.en: able to be pastured (used as grazing land), or suitable for grazing animals
definition.zh: 可放牧的；适合放牧的（指土地/草场可供牲畜吃草）

examples.en: The valley has depasturable grassland for sheep in spring.
examples.zh: 这条山谷在春季有可供绵羊放牧的草地。

examples.en: They assessed which fields were depasturable before moving the cattle.
examples.zh: 在转移牛群之前，他们评估了哪些田地适合放牧。

extraExplanation: “depasturable”来自动词“depasture”（放牧、在……上放牧），常见于农业、土地管理或较正式的书面语中。日常英语里更常说“grazing land”“suitable for grazing”或“pasture (adj.)”。
前缀“de-”在这个词里并不是“去除”的意思，而是历史用法中形成的动词形式（depasture = to pasture）。

summary.en: Depasturage means grazing animals on pasture, or the right/fee to graze animals on another person’s land.
summary.zh: depasturage 指放牧行为，也可指在他人土地上放牧的权利或费用。

definition.en: the act of grazing animals on pasture; the use of land for grazing
definition.zh: （牲畜）在牧场上吃草的行为；放牧（对土地的利用）

examples.en: The farmer allowed depasturage on the lower field after the harvest.
examples.zh: 收割后，农场主允许在低洼地块上放牧。

examples.en: Seasonal depasturage helps reduce feed costs.
examples.zh: 季节性放牧有助于降低饲料成本。

definition.en: the right or fee for grazing animals on someone else’s land
definition.zh: 在他人土地上放牧的权利；（放牧）使用费

examples.en: They negotiated depasturage for 50 cattle during the summer months.
examples.zh: 他们协商在夏季为50头牛取得放牧权。

examples.en: The contract included a depasturage charge per head of livestock.
examples.zh: 合同包含按每头牲畜计费的放牧费用。

extraExplanation: 这个词比较少见，多见于英式英语、农业管理或法律/合同语境（如土地租赁、放牧许可）。日常英语里更常用 grazing（放牧）、pasture（牧场/草地）、grazing rights（放牧权）。
词源上与 pasture（牧场）有关：de- + pasturage（放牧/牧场使用），整体指“在草地上放牧（或其权利/费用）”。

summary.en: Depasturation means grazing animals on land, or (formally) the legal right to do so.
summary.zh: depasturation 指“放牧”，也可指（正式/法律语境）“放牧权”。

definition.en: the act of grazing animals on land; pasturing.
definition.zh: 放牧；让牲畜在土地上吃草的行为。

examples.en: Depasturation of sheep is common on open grasslands in spring.
examples.zh: 春天，在开阔草地上放牧羊群很常见。

examples.en: The farmer planned the depasturation schedule to avoid overgrazing.
examples.zh: 农夫制定了放牧时间表，以避免过度啃食草地。

definition.en: (law, formal) the right or permission to graze animals on a piece of land.
definition.zh: （法律/正式用语）在某块土地上放牧的权利或许可。

examples.en: The contract included depasturation rights for up to twenty cattle.
examples.zh: 合同包含最多二十头牛的放牧权。

examples.en: Villagers negotiated depasturation on the common land.
examples.zh: 村民就公共土地的放牧权进行协商。

extraExplanation: 这是一个比较少见、偏正式的词，常见于农业、历史文献或法律语境。日常英语更常用 grazing（吃草/放牧）、pasture（牧场/放牧）或 grazing rights（放牧权）。
词形来自 pastur-（与 pasture/pastureland“牧草、牧场”同源）+ -ation（名词后缀，表示“行为/过程”）。前缀 de- 在这里并非“去除”，更多是历史构词习惯，整体意思仍围绕“放牧/牧放权”。

summary.en: Depasture means to let animals graze on pasture, or to graze land down by feeding animals on it.
summary.zh: Depasture 指放牧（让牲畜在草场吃草），也可指把草地放牧到草被啃短、被消耗。

definition.en: to put animals (especially cattle or sheep) to graze on pasture; to feed them by grazing.
definition.zh: （尤指牛羊）放牧；让（牲畜）在牧场上吃草。

examples.en: In summer, many farmers depasture cattle on higher ground where the grass is fresh.
examples.zh: 夏天，许多农民会把牛赶到较高的草场放牧，那里草更鲜。

examples.en: The landowner allowed villagers to depasture their sheep on the common land.
examples.zh: 地主允许村民在公地上放牧羊群。

definition.en: to graze (land) so that the grass is eaten down; to use up pasture by grazing.
definition.zh: （使草地）被吃光、被啃短；通过放牧消耗牧草。

examples.en: If you depasture the field too heavily, the grass may not recover quickly.
examples.zh: 如果你过度放牧，这块地的草可能恢复得很慢。

examples.en: They rotated the animals so no single meadow would be depastured.
examples.zh: 他们轮换放牧，以免某一片草地被啃得太厉害。

extraExplanation: “depasture”在现代英语里相对少见，更常见的表达是“graze (animals)”（让动物吃草）、“pasture (animals)”（放牧）或“put animals out to pasture”（把动物放到草场上）。
词形上，“de-”在这里不一定表示“去除”，更多是历史用法中的构词方式；在农业、土地管理或较正式/文学化的语境中偶尔能见到。

summary.en: “Depastured” means animals were put out to feed on grass; they were grazed/pastured.
summary.zh: “depastured”表示“（牲畜）被放到草地上吃草、被放牧”。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “depasture”: to put animals on land so they can eat grass; to graze livestock on pasture.
definition.zh: “depasture”的过去式/过去分词：把牲畜放到牧场（草地）上吃草；在牧地放牧。

examples.en: The cattle were depastured on the hillside during summer.
examples.zh: 夏天牛群在山坡上放牧。

examples.en: She depastured her sheep on the common land with the neighbors’ permission.
examples.zh: 在邻居允许下，她把羊放到共有土地上吃草。

definition.en: describes animals that have been grazing on pasture (used like an adjective in some texts).
definition.zh: （在一些文本中作形容词用）指“已在牧场吃草的/放过牧的（牲畜）”。

examples.en: Depastured animals were brought back to the barn at dusk.
examples.zh: 黄昏时分，放牧过的牲畜被赶回谷仓。

extraExplanation: “depasture / depastured”在现代日常英语里很少见，更常见的说法是“graze (animals)”或“pasture (animals)”。
它较常出现在英式英语、农业/地方法律或土地使用语境中，例如谈“common land（共有牧地）”上放牧权。

summary.en: Depasturing means letting animals graze on pasture; it can also mean the act of pasturing.
summary.zh: depasturing 指让牲畜在牧场吃草（放牧），也可指放牧这一行为。

definition.en: the act of letting animals graze on grassland; pasturing
definition.zh: 让牲畜在牧场吃草的行为；放牧

examples.en: Depasturing is common in spring when the grass begins to grow.
examples.zh: 春天草开始生长时，放牧很常见。

examples.en: The farmer planned depasturing on the open hill pasture.
examples.zh: 农夫计划把牲畜赶到山坡的开阔牧场去放牧。

definition.en: to let (animals) feed on pasture; to pasture
definition.zh: 让（牲畜）在牧场吃草；放牧

examples.en: They are depasturing sheep on the rented fields this month.
examples.zh: 这个月他们在租来的田地上放牧绵羊。

examples.en: The village used to depasture cattle near the river.
examples.zh: 这个村子过去常在河边放牧牛群。

extraExplanation: “depasturing”来自动词“depasture”，比较少见、略带书面/古旧色彩。日常英语更常说“graze (animals) / pasture (animals)”或“let the animals graze”。
词根上可理解为“让……在pasture（牧草地）上进食”。在农业、土地使用或较正式的写作中偶尔会见到。

summary.en: Depratriate means to force someone to live outside their native country, or to strip/deny their citizenship.
summary.zh: depatriate 指迫使某人离开祖国（使其在国外生活），或剥夺/取消其国籍。

definition.en: to force someone to leave their home country, or to make someone live outside their native country (often by policy or pressure)
definition.zh: 迫使某人离开祖国；使某人在本国之外生活（常带有政策或压力的意味）

examples.en: After the regime change, several dissidents were depatriated and could not return.
examples.zh: 政权更迭后，一些异议人士被迫离境，无法回国。

examples.en: The journalist said the government tried to depatriate critics instead of addressing their complaints.
examples.zh: 那位记者说，政府试图把批评者赶出国外，而不是回应他们的诉求。

definition.en: to remove or deny someone’s citizenship; to make someone no longer legally belong to their country
definition.zh: 剥夺（或取消）某人的国籍；使其在法律上不再属于某国

examples.en: In extreme cases, a state may depatriate people by revoking their citizenship.
examples.zh: 在极端情况下，国家可能通过撤销国籍来剥夺一些人的国籍地位。

examples.en: Human-rights groups criticized the attempt to depatriate him without due process.
examples.zh: 人权组织批评在缺乏正当程序的情况下试图剥夺他的国籍。

extraExplanation: “depatriate”较少见，更常见的相关词是“expatriate”（使……侨居国外/移居国外）和“deport”（驱逐出境）。相比之下，“depatriate”更强调“与祖国的归属/国籍关系被切断”，语气往往更正式、政治色彩更强。
词源上可理解为 de-（去除、脱离）+ patriot/patria（祖国）。因此它既可指“被迫离开祖国”，也可指“被剥夺国籍”。在新闻、历史或法律语境中更可能出现。

summary.en: Depauperate means extremely poor or (in science) impoverished in nutrients or diversity.
summary.zh: Depauperate 指“极度贫困的”；在科学语境中也指“贫乏/贫瘠（养分或多样性减少）”。

definition.en: (Of a person, community, or economy) extremely poor; lacking money, resources, or opportunities.
definition.zh: （人、群体或经济）极度贫困的；缺乏金钱、资源或机会的。

examples.en: Many depauperate families struggle to afford basic healthcare.
examples.zh: 许多极度贫困的家庭难以负担基本医疗。

examples.en: The report highlights depauperate rural areas with limited access to jobs and education.
examples.zh: 报告强调了一些极度贫困的农村地区，就业和教育机会有限。

definition.en: (Biology/Ecology) made weaker or less rich in nutrients or diversity; impoverished.
definition.zh: （生物/生态）变得贫瘠的；养分或多样性减少的；衰弱的。

examples.en: Overfarming can leave the soil depauperate and unable to support healthy crops.
examples.zh: 过度耕作会使土壤变得贫瘠，无法支持健康作物生长。

examples.en: Pollution may create a depauperate habitat with fewer species.
examples.zh: 污染可能造成一个物种更少、更贫乏的栖息地。

extraExplanation: “depauperate”比较正式、书面，常见于新闻报道、学术写作或政策讨论中；日常口语里更常用 poor / very poor / impoverished。
词源来自拉丁语 de-（使……变得）+ pauper（贫穷的），核心含义是“使变穷/变贫乏”。
在生态学语境中，depauperate 不仅指“穷”，更强调“多样性降低、组成变单一”（例如“depauperate fauna/flora”指物种较少的动物群/植物群）。

summary.en: Depauperation means the process of becoming impoverished, or (in academic contexts) becoming less rich, diverse, or vital.
summary.zh: Depauperation 指“贫困化/变贫”，也可在学术语境中指“（多样性或活力的）衰减、贫乏化”。

definition.en: the process of becoming poor or being made poor; impoverishment
definition.zh: 变贫；使贫困的过程；贫困化

examples.en: The report warns that rising rents may lead to the depauperation of low-income families.
examples.zh: 报告警告，房租上涨可能导致低收入家庭陷入贫困化。

examples.en: After years of war, the depauperation of the countryside was hard to reverse.
examples.zh: 多年战争之后，农村的贫困化很难扭转。

definition.en: (also used in academic writing) a reduction in richness or vitality, especially in nature or culture
definition.zh: （学术用语）衰减、贫乏化；尤指自然或文化的多样性/活力减少

examples.en: Scientists studied the depauperation of local bird species after the wetlands were drained.
examples.zh: 科学家研究了湿地被排干后当地鸟类物种的衰减。

examples.en: Some critics argue that formulaic content can cause the depauperation of public debate.
examples.zh: 一些评论者认为套路化内容会导致公共讨论的贫乏化。

extraExplanation: 这个词比较少见、偏书面，常见于社会科学或生态学语境。
词源上可理解为 de-（使……）+ pauper（贫穷的人）→ depauperate（使贫困/变贫乏）→ depauperation（名词）。
在生态学里，depauperation 常指“物种变少、群落变贫乏”，不一定和经济贫穷直接相关。

summary.en: Depauperization means the process of becoming less poor or reducing poverty.
summary.zh: Depauperization 指“脱贫/减贫的过程”，即贫困状况的改善。

definition.en: the process of reducing poverty or the condition of being poor; becoming less impoverished
definition.zh: （个人或社会）减少贫困、摆脱贫困的过程；贫困状况的改善

examples.en: The report links depauperization to better access to education and healthcare.
examples.zh: 报告将脱贫与更好的教育和医疗可及性联系起来。

examples.en: After years of stable jobs, many families experienced depauperization.
examples.zh: 在稳定就业多年后，许多家庭逐渐实现了脱贫。

examples.en: Policies that support small businesses can speed up depauperization in rural areas.
examples.zh: 支持小微企业的政策可以加快农村地区的脱贫进程。

extraExplanation: 这个词比较少见，更多出现在社会学、经济学或公共政策语境中，常与“poverty reduction（减贫）”“economic uplift（经济改善）”等概念接近。
构词上来自 de-（去除、减少）+ pauper（穷人）+ -ization（……化/过程），与更常见的 pauperization（贫困化）含义相反。写作中若面向大众读者，通常用“poverty reduction”会更自然。

summary.en: “Depauperize” means to reduce poverty or make someone/someplace less poor.
summary.zh: “depauperize”指减少贫困、使某人或某地摆脱贫困。

definition.en: to make (a person, group, or place) less poor; to improve economic conditions; to enrich.
definition.zh: 使（个人、群体或地区）摆脱贫困；改善经济状况；使更富足。

examples.en: The charity’s long-term goal is to depauperize rural communities through education and jobs.
examples.zh: 该慈善机构的长期目标是通过教育和就业让农村社区摆脱贫困。

examples.en: Some policies aim to depauperize families by raising wages and expanding childcare support.
examples.zh: 一些政策旨在通过提高工资和扩大托育支持来帮助家庭脱贫。

extraExplanation: “depauperize”非常少见，更多场合会用更自然的表达，如：reduce poverty（减少贫困）、lift people out of poverty（让人们脱贫）、alleviate poverty（缓解贫困）、enrich（使更富足）。
词形构成：de-（去除、解除）+ pauper（贫民）+ -ize（使……化），字面意思是“去除贫民状态”。通常用于正式或学术语境。

summary.en: Depauperized means “made less poor; relieved from poverty,” and it can also function as the past participle of depauperize (“to reduce poverty in”).
summary.zh: depauperized 意为“使摆脱贫困的/不再贫困的”，也可作动词 depauperize（“使减少贫困、去贫困化”）的过去分词。

definition.en: made less poor; relieved from poverty (often used in social policy or economic history contexts).
definition.zh: 使摆脱贫困的；让人（或群体）不再贫困的（多见于社会政策或经济史语境）。

examples.en: The program aimed to create a depauperized rural population through stable jobs and access to education.
examples.zh: 该项目旨在通过稳定就业和教育机会，让农村人口摆脱贫困。

examples.en: After several years of investment, the community became noticeably depauperized compared with the past.
examples.zh: 经过几年的投入，这个社区相比过去明显不那么贫困了。

definition.en: past participle of “depauperize”: to reduce poverty in (a person, group, or place); to make less impoverished.
definition.zh: “depauperize”的过去分词：使（个人、群体或地区）减少贫困；使不再贫困。

examples.en: They hoped the reforms would depauperize the region over time.
examples.zh: 他们希望这些改革能随着时间推移让该地区减少贫困。

examples.en: The area was gradually depauperized by new industries and better infrastructure.
examples.zh: 随着新产业和更好的基础设施，这个地区逐渐摆脱了贫困。

extraExplanation: “depauperized”比较少见，属于较正式/学术的用词。它由前缀 de-（表示“去除、减少”）+ pauper（穷人、贫民）构成，字面意思是“去贫困化”。日常英语更常用的说法是: lifted out of poverty, reduced poverty, improved living standards。

summary.en: Depauville is mainly a proper name, best known as a small community in New York State.
summary.zh: Depauville 主要是专有名词，最常见的是指纽约州的一个小社区。

definition.en: a place name (proper noun), most commonly referring to Depauville, a small community (hamlet) in Jefferson County, New York, USA
definition.zh: （专有名词）地名；最常指美国纽约州杰斐逊县的一个小社区（村落）Depauville

examples.en: Depauville is a small community in northern New York State.
examples.zh: Depauville 是纽约州北部的一个小社区。

examples.en: She drove through Depauville on the way to the Thousand Islands region.
examples.zh: 她去千岛群岛地区的路上开车经过了 Depauville。

extraExplanation: “Depauville”不属于常见英语词汇，更多是地名/姓氏化的拼写，因此在不同地区读音可能略有差异。
该地名常被认为与法语姓氏（如 De Pau/Depau）有关，后缀 -ville 在地名中常表示“城镇/聚落”（类似法语/英语中的“……镇”）。

summary.en: DePauw is a proper name most often referring to DePauw University in Indiana, and it can also be a surname.
summary.zh: DePauw 是专有名词，最常指美国印第安纳州的德堡大学，也可用作姓氏。

definition.en: A proper name, most commonly referring to DePauw University, a private liberal arts college in Greencastle, Indiana, USA.
definition.zh: 专有名词，最常指美国印第安纳州格林卡斯尔的德堡大学（DePauw University），一所私立文理学院。

examples.en: She is applying to DePauw because she wants a small liberal arts college experience.
examples.zh: 她申请德堡大学，因为她想体验小型文理学院的学习环境。

examples.en: DePauw has a strong tradition of student organizations and campus activities.
examples.zh: 德堡大学在学生社团和校园活动方面有很强的传统。

definition.en: A family name (surname).
definition.zh: 姓氏（DePauw/De Pauw）。

examples.en: Dr. DePauw will speak at the conference tomorrow.
examples.zh: 德堡博士明天将在会议上发言。

extraExplanation: 拼写与大小写：常见写法为“DePauw”（P大写），也会见到“De Pauw”（分开写）。作为专有名词，通常首字母大写。
读音提示：重音一般落在第二音节（-Pauw），英语中常按“duh-PAW”来读。
词源小知识：该姓氏常被认为与荷兰语有关，“de pauw”在荷兰语里与“孔雀”有关（不同地区与家族可能略有差异）。
文化/语境：在美国教育语境里，“DePauw”最常直接指德堡大学；写作中第一次出现可写全名“DePauw University”，之后用“DePauw”指代学校。

summary.en: Depaysé (often written depayse in English contexts) describes the feeling of being out of place in unfamiliar surroundings; rarely, it can mean to cause that feeling.
summary.zh: Depaysé（英语语境中有时写作 depayse）指在陌生环境中的“不适应/异地感”；少数情况下也可作动词，表示“使人产生这种异地感”。

definition.en: (Borrowed from French) Feeling out of place or pleasantly disoriented because you are in unfamiliar surroundings; experiencing “culture shock” or a sense of being removed from your usual environment.
definition.zh: （源自法语的借词）因身处陌生环境而感到不适应、迷惘，或带点新鲜感的“异地感”；类似“文化冲击/离开熟悉环境后的不适应”。

examples.en: After a week in Tokyo, she still felt depaysé, even though she loved the city.
examples.zh: 在东京待了一周后，她仍然有种异地不适应的感觉，尽管她很喜欢这座城市。

examples.en: The film tries to recreate that depaysé feeling of stepping into a world that runs by different rules.
examples.zh: 这部电影试图重现那种走进一个“规则不同的世界”时产生的异地迷惘感。

definition.en: (Rare) To take someone out of their familiar setting; to make someone feel out of place by changing their environment.
definition.zh: （较少见）把某人带离熟悉的环境；通过环境改变让某人感到不适应。

examples.en: Moving every year can depayse a child, even if the schools are good.
examples.zh: 即使学校不错，每年搬家也可能让孩子感到很不适应。

examples.en: The author depayses the reader with sudden shifts in place and time.
examples.zh: 作者通过地点与时间的突然转换，让读者产生强烈的异地感。

extraExplanation: “dépayse / dépaysé”来自法语动词“dépayser”（把人从熟悉的‘国家/地方’带走）。在英语里多见于文学、影评、旅行写作等较文艺的语境，有时会保留法语重音写作“dépaysé”。
它既可以指负面的“不适应、迷失”，也常用于较正面的“新奇、被打开感官”的体验。常与 travel、city、culture、atmosphere、feeling 搭配。

summary.en: Depaysee (from French “dépaysé”) means feeling out of place or disoriented in an unfamiliar setting.
summary.zh: Depaysee（源自法语“dépaysé”）指在陌生环境中感到格格不入或迷失、不适应。

definition.en: feeling out of place in a new or unfamiliar environment; disoriented (borrowed from French)
definition.zh: （借自法语）在陌生环境中感到不自在、格格不入；有些迷失、失去方向感

examples.en: On my first day in Tokyo, I felt completely depaysee.
examples.zh: 在东京的第一天，我完全感到很 depaysee（不自在、格格不入）。

examples.en: After moving to a small town, she was depaysee for a few weeks.
examples.zh: 搬到小镇后，她有几周都觉得很不适应。

extraExplanation: “dépaysé”来自法语：de-（离开）+ pays（国家/家乡），字面意思是“离开自己的地方”。英语里多见于旅行写作、文学或较讲究的文风中，常用来表达一种“身在异乡”的心理落差与文化冲击。
英语里拼写有时会写作 depaysé（带重音符号）或 depayse / depaysee（不带重音、音译式写法）。正式写作更常见 dépaysé / depaysé。

summary.en: DEPCA is usually an acronym; its meaning varies by context and needs the full form or surrounding text to define accurately.
summary.zh: DEPCA 通常是缩写；含义因语境而异，需要全称或上下文才能准确解释。

definition.en: An acronym whose meaning depends on the specific organization or context; it is not a common standard English word on its own.
definition.zh: 一个缩写词，具体含义取决于使用场景或机构；它本身不是常见的标准英语单词。

examples.en: What does DEPCA stand for in this document?
examples.zh: 在这份文件里，DEPCA 代表什么？

examples.en: DEPCA isn’t clear without context—could you share the full name or a sentence?
examples.zh: 没有上下文 DEPCA 不太明确——你能提供全称或一句原文吗？

extraExplanation: “DEPCA”更像是某个单位/项目/法规名称的首字母缩写，而不是常见词汇。不同领域可能会用到同样的缩写，但含义完全不同。
为了给出准确释义，请你补充：它出现的国家/地区、行业（政府/环保/教育/医疗等）、以及一整句原文或全称。

summary.en: “depe” isn’t a standard English word; it’s probably a partial spelling of “depend/dependent/depends.”
summary.zh: “depe”不是标准英语单词；多半是“depend/dependent/depends”等词的未输入完整形式。

definition.en: Not a standard English word; likely an incomplete or misspelled form of another word (most often “depend,” “dependent,” or “depends”).
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词；很可能是未输入完整或拼写错误的形式（最常见是 depend、dependent 或 depends）。

examples.en: Did you mean “depend” (as in “It depends”)?
examples.zh: 你是不是想写“depend”（比如“It depends / 这要看情况”）？

examples.en: If you meant “dependent,” you can say: “Children are dependent on adults.”
examples.zh: 如果你想表达“dependent（依赖的）”，可以说：“Children are dependent on adults. / 孩子依赖成人。”

extraExplanation:
“depe”在英语里通常不会单独出现。最常见的情况是你在输入时还没打完：
1) depend /dɪˈpɛnd/（依赖；取决于）：It depends.（看情况。）
2) dependent /dɪˈpɛndənt/（依赖的；受抚养的）：be dependent on（依赖……）
3) depends /dɪˈpɛndz/（depend 的第三人称单数）：It depends on the weather.（取决于天气。）
如果你告诉我你想表达的中文意思或给我一个完整句子，我可以帮你确定到底是哪一个词。

summary.en: Depeach is an archaic verb meaning to formally accuse someone, especially in a legal or political sense (impeach).
summary.zh: Depeach 是一个古用动词，意思是正式指控某人（尤其在法律或政治语境中，相当于 impeach“弹劾/控告”）。

definition.en: (Archaic) To accuse someone formally of wrongdoing; to impeach.
definition.zh: （古用）正式指控某人有不当行为；弹劾。

examples.en: In older legal writing, a minister might be depeached for corruption.
examples.zh: 在较早的法律文体中，大臣可能因贪腐而被“depeached”（弹劾/控告）。

examples.en: The pamphlet tried to depeach the official, but it offered little evidence.
examples.zh: 那本小册子试图控告那位官员，但几乎没有证据。

definition.en: (Rare, archaic) To blame or charge someone with a fault; to accuse.
definition.zh: （罕见，古用）责怪；归咎于；指责。

examples.en: He was depeached of neglect by his rivals.
examples.zh: 他被对手指责玩忽职守。

extraExplanation: “depeach”在现代英语中几乎不用；现在更常见的是“impeach”（弹劾/控告）或“accuse”（指控）。
它与动词“peach”（英式口语：告发、出卖某人）在形式上相近，但“depeach”更偏正式、旧式，常见于历史文本或仿古写作。

summary.en: “Depeccer” is not standard English; it’s likely a misspelling or a non-English word, often confused with French forms related to “dispatch.”
summary.zh: “depeccer”不是标准英语；多半是拼写错误或外来词形式，常与法语中与“dispatch（派遣/急件）”相关的词混淆。

definition.en: Not a standard English word. It is likely a misspelling or a non-English form (often confused with French words like “dépêche”/“dépêcher,” related to “dispatch”).
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词。很可能是拼写错误或来自其他语言（常见混淆是法语“dépêche / dépêcher”，意思与英语“dispatch（派遣/急件）”相关）。

examples.en: I can’t find “depeccer” in an English dictionary—did you mean “dispatch”?
examples.zh: 我在英文词典里找不到“depeccer”——你是不是想写“dispatch”？

examples.en: The reporter sent a dispatch from the capital.
examples.zh: 记者从首都发来一则通讯/急件。

extraExplanation:
“depeccer”很像把法语词形误当成英语来拼写：
- 法语名词 **dépêche** 常指“（新闻）通讯、急件”。
- 法语动词 **dépêcher** 有“派遣、赶紧做完、迅速送出”的意思。
如果你告诉我它出现的句子或语境（聊天、作业、小说、游戏等），我可以更准确判断你原本想写的英文单词（例如 **dispatch / depict / depeck** 等可能性）。

summary.en: Depêche is a French loanword meaning a quick official message (a dispatch); in everyday English, dispatch is more common. It also appears as “Depeche” in the band name Depeche Mode.
summary.zh: depêche 是法语借词，指“急件/快讯（dispatch）”，日常英语更常用 dispatch；它也常以“Depeche”出现在乐队名 Depeche Mode 中。

definition.en: (Rare in English) a dispatch; an official message, especially one sent quickly.
definition.zh: （英语中较少见）急件；公文电报/快讯，尤指快速发送的正式消息。

examples.en: The embassy sent a depêche to the foreign ministry late that night.
examples.zh: 大使馆在当晚很晚向外交部发出了一份急件。

examples.en: According to a depêche from Paris, the talks will resume tomorrow.
examples.zh: 据一份来自巴黎的快讯称，会谈将于明天继续。

definition.en: Proper noun: the name “Depeche” most commonly refers to the band name in “Depeche Mode.”
definition.zh: 专有名词：“Depeche”最常见于乐队名“Depeche Mode”（赶时髦/潮流电台的含义常被提及）。

examples.en: Depeche Mode became famous for its electronic sound in the 1980s.
examples.zh: Depeche Mode 因其在20世纪80年代的电子乐风格而成名。

extraExplanation: “dépêche”来自法语，原意是“急件/快讯”，与英语 dispatch 意思相近。英语里更常用 dispatch；写作 depêche 时有时会保留法语重音符号（é），但在英文文本中也常写作 depeche。
“Depeche Mode”这个团名源自法语表达，常被解释为“赶时髦/时尚快讯”之类的意味；在英文语境中提到 Depeche 通常就是指这支乐队。

summary.en: “Depectible” is likely a misspelling of **despicable**: extremely bad or morally disgusting; deserving hate and contempt.
summary.zh: “depectible” 很可能是 **despicable** 的拼写错误：指“极其卑鄙/可鄙”，道德上令人厌恶，值得鄙视。

definition.en: Spelling note: The usual word is **despicable** (not *depectible*). It means very bad or dishonest, causing strong dislike and no respect.
definition.zh: 拼写提示：常见正确拼写是 **despicable**（不是 *depectible*）。意思是“卑鄙的、可鄙的”，非常坏或不诚实，让人强烈厌恶、毫无尊重。

examples.en: It was despicable to lie to people who trusted you.
examples.zh: 欺骗信任你的人是很卑鄙的。

examples.en: The report exposed despicable behavior in the company.
examples.zh: 这份报告揭露了公司里可鄙的行为。

extraExplanation: 你输入的 *depectible* 不是常见英语单词，最接近且最常用的可能是 **despicable**。它来自拉丁语词根，含义与“鄙视/轻视”有关，所以语气很强，常用于道德评价（例如欺骗、虐待、背叛等）。
近义词强度对比：**bad**（一般的“坏”）< **awful/terrible**（很糟）< **despicable**（道德上卑劣、令人鄙视）。在日常表达里，用 despicable 往往表示“非常严重、不能原谅”。

summary.en: “Depeculate” is not standard English; it’s usually a misspelling (often of “deprecate”).
summary.zh: “depeculate”不是标准英语词；通常是拼写错误（常见为把“deprecate”写错）。

definition.en: (Nonstandard) Not a commonly recognized English word; it is most often a misspelling of “deprecate” or (less commonly) “defecate.”
definition.zh: （非标准）这不是一个常见、被广泛认可的英语单词；通常是把“deprecate”（反对/贬低）或（较少见）“defecate”（排便）拼错了。

examples.en: I think you meant “deprecate,” not “depeculate.”
examples.zh: 我觉得你想写的是“deprecate”，不是“depeculate”。

examples.en: In formal writing, avoid using “depeculate” because most readers won’t recognize it.
examples.zh: 在正式写作中避免使用“depeculate”，因为大多数读者不认识这个词。

extraExplanation: “deprecate”更常见：表示“反对（某做法）”或“贬低、轻视（某人/某事）”，如：Many experts deprecate the plan（许多专家反对这个计划）；He deprecated his own achievements（他贬低自己的成就）。
如果你本来想表达“侵吞公款/贪污”，常见动词是“embezzle”或较正式的“peculate”（较少用）；“depeculate”在现代英语里几乎不作为标准词条出现。
如果你想写的是“defecate”，这是医学/正式用语，意思是“排便”；日常更常说“use the bathroom / go to the toilet”。

summary.en: “Depict” means to represent or show something clearly in art, writing, film, or words.
summary.zh: “depict”表示用艺术作品、文字或影像清楚地描绘/刻画某人或某事。

definition.en: To show or represent someone or something in a picture, movie, story, or description.
definition.zh: （用图画、电影、故事或文字）描绘；描写；刻画（人或事物）。

examples.en: The painting depicts a quiet village at sunrise.
examples.zh: 这幅画描绘了日出时宁静的村庄。

examples.en: The novel depicts the struggles of immigrant families.
examples.zh: 这部小说刻画了移民家庭的艰难处境。

examples.en: The documentary depicts how the city has changed over time.
examples.zh: 这部纪录片展现了这座城市如何随着时间而变化。

extraExplanation: 你输入的 **depeinct** 应该是拼写错误，正确拼写通常是 **depict**。
常见搭配：**depict someone/something as...**（把……描绘成……）。例如：*The media depicted him as a hero.*（媒体把他描绘成英雄。）
与近义词的区别：**describe** 更强调“用语言描述”；**portray** 更强调“刻画人物形象/扮演（角色）”；**illustrate** 常指“用图示说明”或“举例说明”。

summary.en: “Depel” is not a standard English word; you probably mean “dispel”: to remove doubts, fears, rumors, or fog.
summary.zh: “depel”不是标准英语词；你可能想写“dispel”：指消除疑虑/恐惧/谣言或驱散雾等。

definition.en: (likely intended: “dispel”) to make a feeling, belief, or doubt go away; to remove something by proving it is not true or by clearing it.
definition.zh: （很可能你想写的是“dispel”）驱散；消除（疑虑、恐惧、谣言等）；澄清（误解）

examples.en: The teacher tried to dispel the students’ fears before the test.
examples.zh: 老师在考试前努力消除学生的恐惧。

examples.en: This report should dispel any doubts about the plan.
examples.zh: 这份报告应该能消除大家对这个计划的疑虑。

examples.en: Sunlight quickly dispelled the morning fog.
examples.zh: 阳光很快驱散了晨雾。

extraExplanation: “depel”并不是常见英语单词，最常见的可能是拼写成了 **dispel**。dis- 有“去除、分开”的意思，-pel 来自拉丁语词根，和“推动、驱动”有关，所以 dispel 有“把某物赶走/驱散”的感觉。
常见搭配：**dispel doubts/fears/rumors/myths**（消除疑虑/恐惧/谣言/迷思）。它通常用于抽象事物（doubts, fears, rumors）或自然现象（fog）。
容易混淆：**repel** 是“击退、排斥（把东西挡在外面）”；**expel** 是“驱逐（把人/物赶出去）”；**dispel** 更偏“让它消散/不再存在”。

summary.en: “Depencil” means to erase or remove pencil lines, especially after inking a drawing.
summary.zh: “depencil”指擦掉或去除铅笔线，尤其是在描墨之后。

definition.en: to remove pencil marks or underdrawing from a surface (often after inking or finalizing a drawing); to erase pencil lines.
definition.zh: （常指在描墨或定稿后）去除铅笔线稿；擦掉铅笔痕迹。

examples.en: After I ink the sketch, I depencil the page so only the clean line art remains.
examples.zh: 我把草图描墨后，会把页面去铅笔线，只留下干净的线稿。

examples.en: The illustrator depenciled the shading before scanning the final artwork.
examples.zh: 插画师在扫描定稿前把阴影的铅笔线擦掉了。

extraExplanation: “depencil”在日常英语里不算常见，更常见的说法是“erase the pencil lines / erase the sketch / remove the pencil marks”。它多出现在漫画、动画、插画等制作流程中：先用铅笔打稿（pencil），再描墨（ink），最后把铅笔稿擦掉（depencil）。
构词上可理解为 de-（去除）+ pencil（铅笔线稿），表示“去掉铅笔痕迹”。

summary.en: Depend usually means “rely on,” “be decided by,” or “count on,” often followed by “on/upon.”
summary.zh: depend 通常表示“依靠/依赖”“取决于”或“指望”，常与 on/upon 搭配。

definition.en: to rely on someone or something for support, help, or what you need
definition.zh: 依靠；依赖（某人或某事）来获得支持、帮助或所需之物

examples.en: Children depend on their parents for food and safety.
examples.zh: 孩子依靠父母获得食物和安全。

examples.en: I depend on public transportation to get to work.
examples.zh: 我靠公共交通去上班。

definition.en: to be decided by; to be true only if something else happens (often used with “depend on”)
definition.zh: 取决于；视……而定（常与 depend on 连用）

examples.en: It depends on the weather.
examples.zh: 这取决于天气。

examples.en: Whether we can go depends on how much it costs.
examples.zh: 我们能不能去取决于费用多少。

definition.en: to trust that something will happen; to count on someone or something
definition.zh: 指望；相信……会发生；指望某人/某事可靠（常与 depend on/upon 连用）

examples.en: You can depend on her to keep a secret.
examples.zh: 你可以指望她会保守秘密。

examples.en: We depend on the team to finish on time.
examples.zh: 我们指望团队按时完成。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：depend on/upon + 人/事（依靠、取决于、指望）。口语里常说 “It depends.” 表示“要看情况/不一定”。
易混词：dependable（adj. 可靠的），dependent（adj. 依赖的；n. 受抚养人），independent（adj. 独立的）。

summary.en: “Dependabilities” means multiple instances or aspects of reliability and trustworthiness.
summary.zh: “Dependabilities”指多方面/多处的可靠性与可信赖性。

definition.en: The qualities of being dependable—reliability and trustworthiness (plural of “dependability”).
definition.zh: 可靠性、可信赖性（“dependability”的复数）。

examples.en: In a crisis, the team’s dependabilities matter more than flashy talent.
examples.zh: 在危机中，团队的可靠性比耀眼的天赋更重要。

examples.en: We evaluated the dependabilities of different suppliers before signing the contract.
examples.zh: 签合同前，我们评估了不同供应商的可靠程度。

definition.en: Reliable features, strengths, or supports that can be counted on (less common).
definition.zh: 可依靠的优点、保障或支撑（较少见）。

examples.en: Her calmness and good judgment were among her dependabilities at work.
examples.zh: 她的冷静和判断力是她在工作中值得依靠的优势之一。

extraExplanation: “dependability”是由动词“depend”（依赖）+ 形容词后缀“-able”（可……的）+ 名词后缀“-ity”（……性）构成，表示“可依赖的性质”。复数“dependabilities”常用于谈论多个系统/人员/方案各自的可靠性或可靠方面。

summary.en: Dependability means being reliable and trustworthy—others can count on you.
summary.zh: Dependability 指可靠、可信赖——别人可以指望你。

definition.en: the quality of being trustworthy and reliable; people can count on you to do what you said you would do
definition.zh: 可靠性；可信赖的品质（别人可以指望你说到做到）

examples.en: Her dependability made her the first person the team called during emergencies.
examples.zh: 她的可靠让她成了团队遇到紧急情况时第一个会联系的人。

examples.en: In customer service, dependability matters as much as friendliness.
examples.zh: 在客户服务中，可靠性和友善同样重要。

extraExplanation: “Dependability”常用于职场与人际关系中，强调“长期稳定地可靠”，不仅是一次做得好，而是持续让人放心。
常见搭配：dependability and reliability（可靠与稳定）、a record of dependability（可靠的记录/口碑）、known for dependability（以可靠著称）。
近义词细微差别：reliability更偏“稳定、故障少”（也可指机器/系统）；trustworthiness更偏“诚实、值得信任”；dependability强调“遇事能靠得住、能按时完成”。

summary.en: Dependable means reliable and able to be trusted or counted on.
summary.zh: Dependable 指“可靠的、可信赖的、靠得住的”。

definition.en: Reliable and trustworthy; you can count on someone or something to do what is expected.
definition.zh: 可靠的；可信赖的；你可以指望某人或某物按预期行事。

examples.en: She’s a dependable friend who always shows up when you need help.
examples.zh: 她是个可靠的朋友，你需要帮忙时她总会出现。

examples.en: We need a dependable internet connection for online classes.
examples.zh: 我们上网课需要稳定可靠的网络连接。

examples.en: This brand is usually dependable, even in cold weather.
examples.zh: 这个品牌通常很可靠，即使在寒冷天气里也是如此。

extraExplanation: “dependable”来自“depend”（依靠、指望），强调“可以依赖”。语气上常用于夸人做事稳、守信用，也可形容物品/系统“稳定不掉链子”。
近义词里，“reliable”更通用；“trustworthy”更强调品格与诚信（尤其用于人）；“consistent”强调前后一贯。

summary.en: Dependableness means the quality of being reliable and able to be trusted.
summary.zh: Dependableness 指“可靠、可信赖”的品质。

definition.en: The quality of being dependable: reliable, trustworthy, and able to be counted on to do what you say you will do.
definition.zh: 可靠性；可信赖：指一个人或事物值得信任、靠得住，能按承诺把事情做好。

examples.en: Her dependableness is why the team trusts her with important tasks.
examples.zh: 她的可靠让团队愿意把重要任务交给她。

examples.en: When you live far away from family, dependableness in friends matters a lot.
examples.zh: 当你住得离家人很远时，朋友的可靠就格外重要。

extraExplanation: “dependableness”常见于书面语或较正式的场合；日常口语里更常说“reliability”或直接用形容词“dependable”。
词根来自“depend”（依靠、取决于），加上形容词后缀“-able”（能够……的）和名词后缀“-ness”（……的性质），表示“值得依靠的这种品质”。
近义词细微区别：reliability更偏向“稳定、持续不出错”；trustworthiness更强调“诚实、不欺骗”；dependableness常同时包含“可靠+守信”。

summary.en: Dependably means “in a reliable, trustworthy way.”
summary.zh: dependably 表示“可靠地、值得信赖地（稳定可预期地）”。

definition.en: In a reliable way; in a way that can be trusted to happen or to be true.
definition.zh: 可靠地；值得信赖地；（事情）可预期地发生/成立。

examples.en: She dependably shows up on time for every meeting.
examples.zh: 她每次开会都很可靠地准时出现。

examples.en: The train runs dependably, even in bad weather.
examples.zh: 这趟火车即使在恶劣天气下也能稳定、可靠地运行。

extraExplanation: “dependably”常用来强调一种“长期稳定的可靠”，比“reliably”更带有“这个人/事一贯值得依靠”的感觉。常见搭配：dependably on time（稳定准时）、dependably good（一直很不错）、dependably deliver（稳定交付/按时完成）。
词形关系：depend（依赖/取决于）→ dependable（可靠的）→ dependably（可靠地）。注意：dependably 不等于“依赖地”，而是“像一个可靠的人/系统那样运作”。

summary.en: Dependance (more commonly spelled “dependence”) means reliance on someone/something, or addiction to a substance.
summary.zh: dependance（更常见拼法为 dependence）指对某人/某物的依赖，或对某种物质的成瘾性依赖。

definition.en: (Usually spelled “dependence” in American English) the state of needing someone or something for support, help, or survival; reliance.
definition.zh: （美式英语通常拼作 dependence）依赖；依靠（在生活、帮助或支持上需要某人/某物）。

examples.en: After the accident, he developed a dependence on his family for daily care.
